title: 108_s1022
content: The "Child and Adult Care Food Program Improvements Act of 2003" amends the eligibility of private organizations under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. It also defines Tier I family or group homes in rural areas. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include a 40 percent requirement for rural areas, and changes are made to school data reporting requirements. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include a 40 percent requirement for rural areas serving elementary school children in the State. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include a 40 percent requirement for rural areas serving elementary school children in the State. Additionally, there are amendments regarding the designation of lists in the Act, with an effective date of October 1, 2005 for the changes. SEC. 4 amends the reimbursement rate for Tier II family or group day care homes by increasing supplements to 18 cents and changing the year to 2004. SEC. 5 addresses the administrative reimbursement rate for family or group day care home sponsoring organizations in rural areas. Section 17(f)(3)(B) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to increase reimbursement levels for administrative expenses for family or group day care home sponsoring organizations in rural areas by $2.00. Annual adjustments to these levels will also be made. SEC. 6. Management support is amended to change the time period from "1999 through 2003" to "2004 through 2008". SEC. 7. Program for at-risk school children in rural areas. The definition of at-risk school children is amended to include a 40 percent threshold in rural areas. The prospective repeal of this amendment is set to take effect on October 1, 2005. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include 13 States, with 11 specified states and 2 additional states. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to raise the age limit for participation in emergency shelters to 18 years. The effective date for this Act and its amendments is October 1, 2003.
